intro: Pseudocarapa crassa, commonly known as the rough sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant has a robust root system and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its seeds are encased in hard pods and dispersed by wind. Pseudocarapa crassa is valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local medicine.
